metadata.name: Project
metadata.description:
Project

Google Cloud Logging collects and stores logs from applications and services on the Google Cloud Platform.

See Gcloud#logging

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
# ...

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new "my-todo-project",
                    "/path/to/keyfile.json"
logging = gcloud.logging

logging.project #=> "my-todo-project"

metadata.name: entries
metadata.description: Lists log entries. Use this method to retrieve log entries from Cloud Logging.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
entries = logging.entries
entries.each do |entry|
  puts entry.name
end

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Gcloud::Logging::Entry::List)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
entries = logging.entries
loop do
  entries.each do |entry|
    puts entry.name
  end
  break unless entries.next?
  entries = entries.next
end

params.name: projects
params.description:
One or more project IDs or project
numbers from which to retrieve log entries.

params.name: filter
params.description: An advanced logs filter. The filter is compared against all log entries in the projects specified by projectIds. Only entries that match the filter are retrieved. An empty filter matches all log entries.

params.name: order
params.description:
How the results should be sorted. Presently, the
only permitted values are “timestamp” (default) and “timestamp desc”.

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

metadata.name: entry
metadata.description: Creates an new Entry object to be populated.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

new_entry = logging.entry.tap do |e|
  e.log_name = "syslog"
  e.resource.type = "cloudsql_database"
  e.timestamp = Time.now
  e.severity = "INFO"
  e.payload = "Export completed"
end

logging.write_entries entry

metadata.name: write_entries
metadata.description: Lists log entries. Use this method to retrieve log entries from Cloud Logging.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

new_entry = logging.entry.tap do |e|
  e.log_name = "syslog"
  e.resource.type = "cloudsql_database"
  e.timestamp = Time.now
  e.severity = "INFO"
  e.payload = "Export completed"
end

logging.write_entries new_entry

examples.caption: You can provide log name for all entries.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

logging.write_entries [entry1, entry2], log_name: "syslog"

params.name: entries
params.description:
One or more entry objects
to write. The log entries must have values for all required fields.

returns.description: Returns true if the entries were written.

metadata.name: logger
metadata.description: Creates a logger object that is API compatible with ruby’s standard library Logger.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

resource = logging.resource "gae_app",
                            module_id: "1",
                            version_id: "20150925t173233"

logger = logging.logger "syslog", resource, env: :production

params.name: log_name
params.description:
A log resource name to be associated with the
written log entries.

params.name: resource
params.description:
The monitored resource to be
associated with written log entries.

params.name: labels
params.description:
A set of user-defined data to be associated with
written log entries.

returns.description:
Logger object that can be used in
place of a ruby standard library logger object.

metadata.name: delete_log
metadata.description: Deletes a log and all its log entries. The log will reappear if it receives new entries.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
logging.delete_log "my-log"

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the log, which may be the full path including the project ID (projects/<project-id>/logs/<log-id>), or just the short name (<log-id>), in which case the beginning of the path will be automatically prepended, using the ID of the current project.

returns.description: Returns true if the log and all its log entries were deleted.

metadata.name: resource_descriptors
metadata.description: Retrieves the list of monitored resource descriptors that are used by Google Cloud Logging.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
resource_descriptors = logging.resource_descriptors
resource_descriptors.each do |resource_descriptor|
  puts resource_descriptor.name
end

examples.caption: Pagination: (See Gcloud::Logging::ResourceDescriptor::List)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
resource_descriptors = logging.resource_descriptors
loop do
  resource_descriptors.each do |resource_descriptor|
    puts resource_descriptor.name
  end
  break unless resource_descriptors.next?
  resource_descriptors = resource_descriptors.next
end

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of resource descriptors to return.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

resource = logging.resource "gae_app",
                            "module_id" => "1",
                            "version_id" => "20150925t173233"

metadata.name: sinks
metadata.description: Retrieves the list of sinks belonging to the project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
sinks = logging.sinks
sinks.each do |sink|
  puts sink.name
end

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Gcloud::Logging::Sink::List)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
sinks = logging.sinks
loop do
  sinks.each do |sink|
    puts sink.name
  end
  break unless sinks.next?
  sinks = sinks.next
end

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of sinks to return.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
sink = logging.create_sink "my-sink"

params.name: name
params.description: The client-assigned sink identifier. Sink identifiers are limited to 1000 characters and can include only the following characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and the special characters _-..

params.name: destination
params.description: The export destination. See Exporting Logs With Sinks.

params.name: filter
params.description: An advanced logs filter that defines the log entries to be exported. The filter must be consistent with the log entry format designed by the version parameter, regardless of the format of the log entry that was originally written to Cloud Logging.

params.name: version
params.description: The log entry version used when exporting log entries from this sink. This version does not have to correspond to the version of the log entry when it was written to Cloud Logging. Accepted values are :unspecified, :v2, and :v1.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
sink = logging.sink "existing-sink"

examples.caption: By default nil will be returned if the sink does not exist.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
sink = logging.sink "non-existing-sink" #=> nil

params.name: sink_name
params.description: Name of a sink.

returns.description: Returns nil if sink does not exist.

metadata.name: metrics
metadata.description: Retrieves the list of metrics belonging to the project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
metrics = logging.metrics
metrics.each do |metric|
  puts metric.name
end

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Gcloud::Logging::Metric::List)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
metrics = logging.metrics
loop do
  metrics.each do |metric|
    puts metric.name
  end
  break unless metrics.next?
  metrics = metrics.next
end

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of metrics to return.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
metric = logging.create_metric "my-metric"

params.name: name
params.description: The client-assigned metric identifier. Metric identifiers are limited to 1000 characters and can include only the following characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and the special characters _-.,+!*',()%/\. The forward-slash character (/) denotes a hierarchy of name pieces, and it cannot be the first character of the name.

params.name: description
params.description:
A description of this metric, which is used
in documentation.

params.name: filter
params.description: An advanced logs filter.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
metric = logging.metric "existing-metric"

examples.caption: By default nil will be returned if the metric does not exist.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
metric = logging.metric "non-existing-metric" #=> nil

params.name: name
params.description: Name of a metric.

returns.description: Returns nil if metric does not exist.

metadata.name: ensure_connection!
metadata.description: Raise an error unless an active connection is available.
